Wisdom: إِنَّ لِلْقُلُوبِ خَوَاطِرَ سُوءٍ وَالْعُقُولُ تَزْجُرُ مِنْهَا
enWisdom: Verily there are evil thoughts that come into the hearts but the intellects deters one from [acting upon] them

Wisdom: إِنَّ هَذِهِ الْقُلُوبَ تُمَلُّ كَمَا تُمَلُّ الْأَبْدَانُ فَابْتَغُوا لَهَا طَرَائِفَ الْحِكَمِ
enWisdom: Verily these hearts grow weary just like bodies become weary, so seek out wise sayings for them

Wisdom: إِنَّ لِلْقُلُوبِ شَهْوَةً وَكَرَاهَةً وَإِقْبَالًا وَإِدْبَاراً فَأْتُوهَا مِنْ إِقْبَالِهَا وَشَهْوَتِهَا فَإِنَّ الْقَلْبَ إِذَا أُكْرِهَ عَمِيَ
enWisdom: Verily hearts have desire and aversion, an advancing and a retreating, so approach them from whence they advance and desire, for indeed when the heart is forced [to do anything] it becomes blind

Wisdom: إِنَّ لِلْقُلُوبِ إِقْبَالًا وَإِدْبَاراً فَإِذَا أَقْبَلَتْ فَاحْمِلُوهَا عَلَى النَّوَافِلِ وَإِذَا أَدْبَرَتْ فَاقْتَصِرُوا بِهَا عَلَى الْفَرَائِضِ
enWisdom: Verily the heart has an advancing and a retreating, so when it advances then make it bear the [performance of] supererogatory acts, but when it retreats then make it suffice with the obligatory acts

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا قَلْبُ الْحَدَثِ كَالْأَرْضِ الْخَالِيَةِ مَهْمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ قَبِلَتْهُ
enWisdom: Verily the heart of a youth is like an empty [cultivation] land, it accepts anything that is sown in it

Wisdom: لِلْقُلُوبِ خَوَاطِرُ سُوءٍ وَالْعُقُولُ تَزْجُرُ عَنْهَا
enWisdom: There are some evil thoughts that come into the hearts, but the intellects deter one from [acting upon] them
